001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
006import java.nio.charset.Charset;
007import java.util.function.Function;
008
009import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
010
011import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
012import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFlags;
013
014/**
015 * A JStachio Template is a renderer that has template meta data.
016 * <p>
017 * Generated code implements this interface.
018 * <p>
019 * While many of the methods allow passing in custom Escapers care must be taken to choose
020 * a proper escaper that supports the original media type and charset of the template.
021 * There is currently no runtime checking that the escaper supports the template's media
022 * type and charset.
023 *
024 * @author agentgt
025 * @param <T> the model type
026 */
027public interface Template<T> extends Renderer<T>, TemplateInfo {
028
029        /**
030         * Renders the passed in model.
031         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
032         * @param appendable the appendable to write to.
033         * @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the appendable
034         */
035        default void execute(T model, Appendable appendable) throws IOException {
036                execute(model, appendable, Formatter.of(templateFormatter()), Escaper.of(templateEscaper()));
037        }
038
039        /**
040         * Renders the passed in model.
041         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
042         * @param a appendable to write to.
043         * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
044         * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
045         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the appendable
046         */
047        public void execute(T model, //
048                        Appendable a, //
049                        Formatter formatter, //
050                        Escaper escaper) throws IOException;
051
052        /**
053         * Renders the passed in model.
054         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
055         * @param a appendable to write to.
056         * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
057         * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
058         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the appendable
059         */
060        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
061        default void execute(T model, //
062                        Appendable a, //
063                        Function<@Nullable Object, String> formatter, //
064                        Function<String, String> escaper) throws IOException {
065                execute(model, a, Formatter.of(formatter), Escaper.of(escaper));
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream using the
070         * {@link #templateCharset()} for encoding. If the template is
071         * {@linkplain JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE pre-encoded} the pre-encoded parts of the
072         * template will be written to the stream for performance otherwise an unbuffered
073         * {@link OutputStreamWriter} will be used.
074         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
075         * @param outputStream to write to.
076         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
077         * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
078         * @see EncodedTemplate
079         */
080        default void write(T model, //
081                        OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
082                OutputStreamWriter ow = new OutputStreamWriter(outputStream, Charset.forName(templateCharset()));
083                execute(model, ow);
084        }
085
086        /**
087         * <strong>EXPERIMENTAL</strong> support of pre-encoded templates that have the static
088         * parts of the template already encoded into bytes. To generate templates that
089         * support this interface and are pre-encoded add {@link JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE}
090         * to the {@linkplain JStacheFlags template flags}.
091         *
092         * <p>
093         * This interface is to support
094         * <a href="https://github.com/fizzed/rocker#near-zero-copy-rendering"> Rocker style
095         * near zero-copy rendering</a> where the static template parts are stored as byte
096         * arrays.
097         * <p>
098         * The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
099         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> thus an array or list of byte arrays
100         * can be accumulated to support almost zero-copy. <strong> Consequently absolutely no
101         * mutation of the byte arrays should happen as they could be reusable static parts of
102         * the template! </strong>
103         * <p>
104         * <em>Overall it is recommended that you do not use this interface unless you have an
105         * intimate knowledge of how your platform buffers data and have byte like access as
106         * current JMH benchmarking indicates that
107         * {@link String#getBytes(java.nio.charset.Charset)} is generally much faster for raw
108         * byte conversion albeit at the possible cost of increased memory. One should peform
109         * their own benchmarking to confirm using this interface is worth it. </em>
110         *
111         * @author agentgt
112         * @param <T> the model type
113         * @apiNote The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
114         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> and no mutation of the passed in
115         * byte array should happen downstream.
116         * @see JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE
117         */
118        public interface EncodedTemplate<T> extends Template<T> {
119
120                /**
121                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
122                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
123                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
124                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
125                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
126                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
127                 * @param outputStream to write to.
128                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
129                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
130                 */
131                default void write(T model, //
132                                OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
133                        write(model, outputStream, Formatter.of(templateFormatter()), Escaper.of(templateEscaper()));
134                }
135
136                /**
137                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
138                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
139                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
140                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
141                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
142                 * <p>
143                 * For performance reasons the passed in escaper is not checked if it supports the
144                 * encoding so care must be taken to use an escaper that supports the static
145                 * {@link #templateCharset()}.
146                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
147                 * @param outputStream to write to.
148                 * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
149                 * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
150                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
151                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
152                 */
153                public void write(T model, //
154                                OutputStream outputStream, //
155                                Formatter formatter, //
156                                Escaper escaper) throws IOException;
157
158        }
159
160}
